ARTICLE.TITLE: Was the U.S. Right to Drop the Atomic Bomb?
ARTICLE.TEXT: John C. Hopkins’s calculations about the consequences of an invasion of Japan conform with the facts (“The Atomic Bomb Saved Millions—Including Japanese,” op-ed, Aug. 6). But history isn’t about counting; it’s about research and evidence. The documents in U.S., Soviet and Japanese archives prove that once the Soviet Union entered the war, everyone—Truman, Stalin and Hirohito—knew Japan would surrender to the U.S. Why?
